reviewText:
Star Wars Republic Commando is a really fun game. It provides an awesome experience in the Star Wars universe.
It is also hard as nails. It feels like quite a challenge, which makes it seem like a much more realistic outlook on the Clone Wars.
I definitely reccomend it, and if you get stuck, you can press the '@' key which opens the console, and type in 'TheMatulaakLives' (This puts you in god mode.)

My one wish would be that it was possible to play the campaign co-op.

But yeah, it's great.

reviewText: One of the best star wars games i have ever played. Love the gameplay, the somewhat realism, and the fact it still works after being older. Its a good story, and unlike most games the map design is not copy and paste. Maybe in some areas, but not many. The multiplayer is great, except from what i have seen no one is on anymore. I have played this on steam but when i got the disc version a few years back i played at least 100 hours. Loved the game, still do. Worth 10 dollars. The only con is that there are a good deal of bugs and glitches, such as unable to complete a part of the story. Also the fact (as is with almost all star wars games) that most people wont pay the price for the game. Star wars games are for true star wars fans, not someone looking to find a fun game. Other than that i still think its an amazing game 10/10

reviewText:
Republic Commando is a tactical first person shooter where you are the leader of a small squad called Delta Squad. The gameplay is much like any other shooter however instead of run and gun the player must order their squadmates to perform different functions such as slice a terminal, set a bomb and get behind cover and use various weapons including sniper, anti-armor and grenade. They will also target one enemy, form up on the player, go to a certain location or search and destroy. On top of that the player has a special weapon called the DC-17 which was interchangeable from assault rifle to sniper rifle to anti-armor launcher. The Player also had a full HUD that made it feel like the player was really in a clone trooper helmet.

One of the other cooler features is instead of dying you just go down and you can either call a squadmate over to revive you, maintain their orders and kill everything before getting you or just reload a save.  A lot of these features worked perfectly it isn’t like whoever could develop the sequel couldn’t just use all these features all over again. It begs the question where is the sequel if the gameplay mechanics are already there and ready to be used again.

You are Delta RC-1138 or “Boss,” the leader of Delta squad who has in it RC-1262, “Scorch,” the comedic relief /explosives expert, RC-1140, “Fixer,” the by the book soldier that specializes in slicing and RC-1207, “Sev,” the hunter/sniper. You start out in your birthing tube on Kamino and it shows your training as you age. Eventually your squad meets up for the invasion of Geonosis during the beginning of the clone wars. There Delta Squad is tasked to infiltrate and assassinate Sun Fac, a Geonosian leader. Along with that they have several other objectives that they accomplish including destroying an underground droid factory and retrieving launch codes from a Trade Federation core ship.
One year after the invasion of Geonosis Delta Squad is set to investigate their original ship the Prosecutor to find out why it has not responded in several weeks. During this they find out the Trandoshan Slaves and Mercenaries have taken over the ship with the help of the Separatists in order to capture and bring the ship back to a Separatist base. Delta Squad ends up destroying all of the Trandoshans and defends the ship from a Trade Federation Battleship that attacks shortly after.

The final mission involves Delta Squad being the advance recon team on Kashyyyk and to help the Wookiees to fight back the Trandoshan Slavers and Separatists that have control of the planet. They end up rescuing General Tarfful and run into General Grievous themselves but only end up fighting those IG-100 Magna Guards that carry the Electrostaff. Eventually Delta Squad makes it to where the Separatist Battleship has linked itself the giant citadel tree and they destroy it. They end the game on a cliffhanger as Sev had been captured and the invasion of Kashyyyk by the main republic force had begun which once again begs the question, why not continue the story and have a sequel.

Now the graphics aren’t anything to write home about but they are fairly impressive for when this game was made, 2005, but what really makes this game look impressive is the HUD for the clone troopers and the art assets they created for the game. Lucasarts did not separate themselves from canon too much in that the story of Delta Squad lines up perfectly with that of the actual Star Wars universe and Extended Universe.
Republic Commando is actually the first Star Wars game that featured licensed music that included the song “Clones” by the band Ash which sounds awesome. On top of that they included all of the heavy battle music from John Williams you may have heard from any of the other Star Wars movies. The voice acting is also superb as for most of the clone troopers and Delta 38 was voiced by the original actor for Jango Fett, Temuera Morrison which I thought was a nice touch.

Overall this game is actually one of my favorite Star Wars games of all time and is an absolute classic in terms of story and gameplay. With the disbandment of Lucasarts, in order to make a sequel some developer is going to have to get rights to both the Star Wars IP and the Republic Commando IP which could make it quite pricey.
•	Story  - 4 out of 5
•	Gameplay – 4 out of 5
•	Graphics – 4 out of 5
•	Sound  - 5 out of 5
•	Fun – 5 out of 5
Pros:
-	Fun gameplay/squad commanding
-	Great music and voice acting
-	Star Wars Universe
Cons:
-	Can get annoyingly difficult with the lack of ammo at times
-	Repetitive enemies
I’m giving a Total score of 90%

reviewText:
This game is up there with Metroid Prime and Unreal as being one of my favorite FPSes ever, plus one of my favorite Star Wars games. I just wish it was longer.

Unlike most FPSes I've played, where the combat's attempt at a frantic pace just makes it an annoying mess of white noise, Republic Commando's squad-based gameplay forces you constantly calculate battlefield tactics as opposed to just trying not to get shot.

The game's biggest weakness comes in a few brief segments where you're forced into a tactical situation by yourself, where one stray bullet can drop you; or when you're given a time limit, which in one case resulted in me finishing a level with literally a second or two left on the clock. The intensity of the firefights makes completing your objectives in time an incredible strain.

Besides that, the game is only three missions: Geonosis, a deralict Republic battlecruiser, and Kashyyyk. Thankfully, each of these missions will last you a good three hours a piece, so I wasn't left feeling like I'd played an unfinished game. I was, however, left wanting a lot more. In particular, the notion of this game's encounters playing out organically, with nonlinear level design (and a lot more levels), sounds like the workings of one of the greatest FPSes ever.

reviewText: There is alot of things this game does right and alot of things this game does wrong. reviewText:
Star Wars: Republic Commando is perhaps the greatest singleplayer FPS ever. Despite looking a bit aged, it runs well and is still as fun as ever.

You play as Delta-38 (Boss), as the leader of Delta Squad, consisting of your explosives specialist and joker Delta-62 (Scorch), your levelheaded computer specialist Delta-40 (Fixer) and resident sniper/psychopath Delta-07 (Sev). You travel between three levels: the desert planet Geonosis, the start of the Clone Wars, the RAS Prosecutor, a derelict Republic Assault Ship (Ex Machina y u do dis to me) and Kashyyyk, home of the Wookies.

The game is particularly notable for its advanced squad AI, which hasn't really been matched since. Your squadmates are easily capable of holding their own for a while, but the perfect balance is struck between the need for player input and AI competence. You also have the ability to command your troops to perform actions such as snipe enemies, hack terminals and man turrets.

In conclusion, Republic Commando is a must-buy for any Star Wars or FPS fan.

10/10 would use AT-TE again.

reviewText: I loved and hated this game. It felt long because the gameplay felt repetitive and long after awhile. The gameplay is pretty much run and gun. The squad is frustrating at times because they aren't too smart and will stand there at times while people are shooting at them. The graphics are kind of old school. The game is good for Star Wars diehards but for the average FPS gamer its something that gets long to play as the game progresses. I felt myself wanting the game to end really early in the game because of how repetitive it got. The great thing about this game was the soundtrack, it was very well done. The online portion of the game is small but still active. The online portion is the thing to play if you want a fun experience with it. The story of the game was confusing and left you wondering. The really annoying thing about this game was the ammo and guns, if felt like you ran out of ammo too fast. Get it if you love Star Wars, but not if your looking for a good story and gameplay.

reviewText:
Oh boy, is this a good game.
Recently I have required some money, and I have to say...I am enjoying these Star Wars sale. To start out, I am a pretty big Star Wars, so even the name of it can make me happy. Anyway, you play as a clone commander in the time between Episode 2 and episode 3, the clone wars. You are in charge of 3 other clone commanders, Fixer: The Hacker, Scorcth: Demolitions expert and Sev: The Brute.
This is imo, one of the few Star Wars games that even non Star Wars fans can play and still enjoy. It is something that is not often seen in this Star Wars genre, First Person, tactical shooter. No, you don't play as a god like- dual lightsaber wielding, maniac (looking at you Force Unleashed!) you play as a clone and only a clone. This itself brings something unique to the playing field.
It offers a compelling story of Delta Squad, and their rise into infamy. As of now, (May 2, 2015)  this game is TEN YEARS OLD, release date: March 1
date: 2005) and while it is obvious from the graphics it is not a "next gen" level game

reviewText:
It's bloody, gritty and rather tricky. A Star Wars game for a more mature demographic with likable characters with, albeit cliched, personalities.

You got your rough and tumble borderline serial killer 07 - Sev

You got the fun and dumb but highly trained demolitionist 62 - Scorch

You got the bottom feeding, intellegent and downright square 40 - Fixer

Then there's you, the quick thinking leader of Delta Squad - 38 - Boss

They may have differing personalities and prefernces but at the end of the day each sqaud member is very copy and paste in terms of usefulness and each one gets the job regardless of what they prefer to do which is good, why leave a Commando half cooked?

The gameplay aspect was astounding. The Ai are intellegent (bar some hiccups) and follow orders very well. You say 'Search and Destory' they'll take point and peek around corners before engaging the enemy.

Say 'Group Up' and, well, they come to you like a Jack Russel that heard a bag open.

Give the order to 'Secure Location' and they actually dig in, taking cover behind objects and not leaving that spot unless you put them on a position but even if one goes the other two stay and keep digging in, its great if you need to heal at a bacta station under heaby fire.

Lastly there's the 'Move On' command which ends whatever action the commando's are doing and will either fall back to a secured location if a marker was placed or come back to you.

In battle you HAVE to be the leader. These guys wont do more than cover and shoot unless you point them towards a turret, sniper location or explosive ordinance spot. There's nothing finer than having all three squad mates on useful points as you go against a small army of droids. There are also non-combat meneuvers like Slicing a terminal, setting a detonator charge or Breaching and Clearing a room. Your surroundings are as much of a weapon as anything though, one part I liked was when I had my squad distract a heavily armoured spider droid while I snuck around the back, sliced a terminal and dropped a crate on its head.

Droids also have this annoying habit of being extremely hard to kill. Maybe the battle droids are easy but Super Battle Droids, Destroyer Droids and Spider Droids are tough and require you to focus the entire squads fire on one at a time. There are other enemy types but I wont spoil it.

All in all this is a fun game but with a sadly abrupt ending. It almost felt like they ran out of funding halfway through and ended it at the worst moment possible. I literally felt like someone came into my bedroom and pulled the blug on my PC, that was how abrupt the ending blackout was.

All in all you can get some 15-16 hours out of it which isn't too bad. It's a good game with solid FPS mechanics and some great voice acting where it counts and despite its abruptness the ending was fairly good and will leave you wanting more.

9/10 solid gameplay with very very few glitches but with an abrupt ending

reviewText: It`s a good and fun game, but it`s not a complex tactical shooter in the Star Wars universe I was hoping for. The gameplay is painfully linear and there`s very little tactial depth to it. You can`t give commands to individual soldiers, sniping positions are fixed and cannot be assigned by the player, and door breaching has no additional options (like throwing in grenades or something). Rainbow six - Vegas has actually more depth and tactics than this and that`s saying something :(\n\nThe levels in this game are very restrictive (You follow a hallway with some rooms). Another giant weakness is setting the game within the prequel trilogy, so you`ll be killing a lot of droids in stead of strom troopers/rebels. The main protagonist uses a Codename outbreak style multi purpose rifle which can be adapted to many different weapon types, which is kind of a letdown. The guns in this game seem to be a little underpowered not doing as much damage as You would like them to do. Iwas generally dissatisfied with this title but for a sci-fi action fan, who likes tactical elements and doesn`t hate the SW prequels- it might be good shooter.

reviewText:
Ah yes this game. A gritty Star Wars FPS playing the role of a Republic Commando taking control of a small squad to complete various tasks in the name of the Republic. This game was quite the blast to play.

First off the combat is fun and engaging with various weapons and a few unique ones too. You also have a squad to command and you can order them to various tasks such as arming explosives, taking sniping positions and so forth. The music holy hell isn't it beautiful? Especially at the title screen.

One of my favourite parts about this game is the amount of detail put into this. You can see your helmet on the wholeway through and when enemy blood splatters on it, it gets wiped away. There are some other cool little things I won't spoil. Not to mention the game looks good in general.

I've played both the PC and Xbox version and I would recommend the PC version. It has better controls overall but the Xbox version is an impressive feat in itself. This was one of the last Star Wars games in the Golden Age of Star Wars games before there was silence but things are looking a little bright now. This game gets an 8/10.

reviewText: A squad based FPS set in the Star Wars universe with you taking on the roll of RC-1138 aka Boss. It's split up into 3 arcs and spawned a 4 part book series that's rather enthralling and I highly recommend as much as this game. It's a game that took on a really unique way of doing things that makes it hard for you to 1 man army and your squad is highly effective if given the right orders. It was designed with a controller in mind but forces KB/M which, when gotten used to, can function quite well.\n\nIt's also got a really great music score and memorable characters.

reviewText:
Great game.

Intense music that made me feel badass. Though few weapons, just perfectly enough for this game. The characters are so lively, it makes the game so much fun. Very intense situations, that while daunting to most people even on easy difficulty, make for exciting challenges for me while on hard difficulty. (I am that good at this game. I wish this game had an extreme intense difficulty.) With all of these things, it's the first game to make me actually emotionally care about the characters and what was happening.

Best game I have ever purchased, 10/10. Albeit short, it's a great thriller from start to end.

This game. Sequel. Now.

reviewText: Probably my new favourite game.\n\nI passed up Republic Commando when it first came out, due to my stupid child mind thinking Star Wars could not be good without Jedi. Oh how I was wrong. Republic Commando takes your generic Space Marine-esque Clone Troopers and makes them something special. You play as the leader of a four-man squad of elite troopers known as Delta Squad. As 38, you command 07, 40 and 62 in a Journey through the barren planet of Geonosis to the forests of Kashyyk. What the real highlight of is comes down to your squad of soldiers and how you control them. Your most basic commands use F1 - F4, with Search and Destroy"
recommended: "Hold This Position" etc. Throughout the maps there are points you can highlight your troops to use. Bacta tanks for healing
voteText: grenade positions. You can get them to slice doors or breach them
helpfulPercent: bomb stuff or do it yourself. The AI of Delta Squad was well ahead of it's time and is still impressive to this day. Each and every member of Delta Squad does one thing better than any other Space Marine in any game though
votesHelpful: and that is their personality. Each member of Delta Squad has a distinct and likable personality
votesTotal: 07 being a gruff
votesFunny: maybe insane hunter
commentsCount: 62 being often childish and 40.... well 40 lacks in that department sadly.\n\nThe levels of Republic Commando are intricate and amazingly well designed. The game is extremely challenging and points but ever so rewarding at the same time. You get four base weapons and can pick up a fifth
column16: of which there are a multitude of to use. You have your base Pistol
column17: a clone trooper rifle thingy
column18: a sniper rifle and a grenade launcher thingerjig. Then you can get miniguns
column19: SMG's
column20: energy shotguns etc to fill your Fifth slot
column21:
which you can change up at will. The FPS and tactics parts of Republic Commando work together extremely well and create a satisfying and fantastic game.

Do you like FPS? Buy it
Like tactical games? Buy it
Like Star Wars? Buy it

Republic Commando is an absolute masterpiece of a game."

reviewText: Agrivating, Frustrating, Hard, but also great fun. I can't get enough of this game, the only problem I really have with it is that the Commandos have American accents rather than an english one like a proper clone. Other than that, It's great, really. The gameplay is great, it feels so solid, and the tension you feel while playing makes you feel as if you're actually a clone fighting in an all-out war. The coolest aspect by far about this game is how you can order your teamates to take positions and do actions, making you feel like a powerful general. Also, at no point in the game did it feel wrong or incomplete. The developers put their 100% into it all the way through, which I respect. I wish that there were Star Wars games as great as this one still around, but sadly they kind of fall flat. Hopefully Star Wars: Battlefront 3 will be great! My score: 10/10 game, play it first chance you get!

reviewText: This is an FPS Star Wars game that puts you in the role of a clone commando soldier. It has a bit of a darker, more realistic tone but still keeps very faithful to the Star Wars licence. In this game teamwork is key and you develope a bond with your brothers/squadmates over time. It has just the right amount of challenge and you can even play co-op with your friends! This is an amazingly designed game that I can recommend to any Star Wars fan.
